Package com.trinhxuantam.threadsafesinglylinkedlist.utils.collections

Class SinglyLinkedList<T>

java.lang.Object
com.trinhxuantam.threadsafesinglylinkedlist.utils.collections.SinglyLinkedList<T>
Type Parameters:
T - the type of elements held in the list
public class SinglyLinkedList<T> extends Object
This class implements a thread-safe singly linked list using atomic references to ensure safe concurrent modifications without the use of explicit locks. The thread safety is based on compare-and-set strategies to ensure that the list is updated atomically and consistently, even when multiple threads are adding or removing elements.

  • Constructor Details

    • SinglyLinkedList

      public SinglyLinkedList()
      Constructs a new SinglyLinkedList with a dummy head node. The dummy head node simplifies edge cases like inserting the first node or removing nodes.

  • Method Details

    • getAll

      public List<T> getAll()
      Retrieves all elements from the list in sequence. This method is thread-safe and can be called concurrently.
      Returns:
      a list containing all elements in the list from head to tail

    • push

      public void push(T value)
      Adds a new element to the end of the list. This method uses a loop with compare-and-set to ensure that the new node is correctly added even if multiple threads are adding nodes simultaneously.
      Parameters:
      value - the element to add

    • insertAfter

      public void insertAfter(T value, T after) throws NoSuchElementException
      Inserts a new element after a specified existing element. This will iterate through the list to find the specified element and insert the new element. This method throws if the specified element after which to insert does not exist.
      Parameters:
      value - the new element to insert
      after - the element after which the new element should be inserted
      Throws:
      NoSuchElementException - if the element 'after' is not found

    • pop

      public T pop() throws IllegalStateException
      Removes and returns the last element from the list. In case of multiple threads popping simultaneously, only one thread will succeed and the second the other ones will retry until the list is updated.
      Returns:
      the last element of the list
      Throws:
      IllegalStateException - if the list is empty
